title: BrokenPipeError via terminalwriter

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: problem that needs to be addressed

labels.name: topic: reporting
labels.description: related to terminal output and user-facing messages and errors

body:
BrokenPipeErrors should be handled better.

The below exception is from interrupting `pytest … | tee /tmp/1` via Ctrl-C.

The pipe is closed, but pytest fails two times loudly while trying to write to it.

This appears to abort any (necessary/useful) shutdown probably, too.
